intro: Baillonia amabilis var. heterophylla, commonly known as the variable baillonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that vary in shape and size, giving it its varietal name. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is a woody shrub or small tree, often found in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in forest edges. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
